definition: a long talk
length/long/forever/always/constantly
chief/head/elder/to grow/to develop/to increase/to enhance
to speak/to talk/to converse/to chat/to discuss
surname Tan

sentences.english: Jim and I have just had a long talk.
sentences.chinese: 我和吉姆刚进行过一次长谈。

sentences.english: A long conversation with a friend.
sentences.chinese: 和好友的一次促膝长谈。

sentences.english: I spent 4 hours chatting with my grandmother in-law last night.
sentences.chinese: 昨晚，我和丈夫的祖母促膝长谈了4个小时。

sentences.english: I have long talked with him on the subject.
sentences.chinese: 关于这个问题我已经和他作过一次长谈。

sentences.english: I've really enjoyed our long talks together at lunch.
sentences.chinese: 我十分喜爱我们在午饭后的长谈。

sentences.english: Whenthe employee leaves your office after a long talk stand up to say good- bye.
sentences.chinese: 当雇员和你长谈之后要离开你办公室时，起身道别。

sentences.english: Time alone with a good book.
sentences.chinese: 和好友的一次促膝长谈。

sentences.english: Call a friend you haven't spoken to recently and have a good long chat.
sentences.chinese: 给一个近来没联系过的朋友打电话，美美的长谈一番。

sentences.english: But it’s OK to have long talks with your children.
sentences.chinese: 但是和孩子进行一次长谈是可以的。

sentences.english: I had a long talk with her that night.
sentences.chinese: 那天晚上，我和她秉烛长谈。

sentences.english: I went down to meet him at the end of last season and had a long chat with him.
sentences.chinese: 上赛季末我去探望过他，并跟他促膝长谈过。

sentences.english: Just want to pull a long process bite gold, but female manager came after.
sentences.chinese: 正想拉住程咬金长谈一番，不料女掌柜追了过来。

sentences.english: When the employee leaves your office after a long talk, stand up to say good- bye.
sentences.chinese: 当雇员和你长谈之后要离开你办公室时，起身道别。

sentences.english: We used to have long phone talks about our babies to share some fun and loss.
sentences.chinese: 我们过去常常在电话里长谈我们的宝宝，分享乐与失。

sentences.english: As a good long talk with a few old friends.
sentences.chinese: 比和几个老朋友促膝长谈更加有效。

sentences.english: On New Year's Eve, my father and my uncle talked about their work together.
sentences.chinese: 除夕那天，我的爸爸和叔叔促膝长谈他们的工作。

definition: to have an in depth conversation/to have intimate talks/to discuss thoroughly
commune/private discussion
to chat
to give one's bare heart into sb else's keeping (idiom); sb has one's absolute confidence/to trust completely/to confide in sb with entire sincerity
to talk (with sb)/to have a conversation/talk/conversation/CL:次[ci4]
to meet with/meeting
to chat
variant of 閒談|闲谈[xian2 tan2]
to talk freely/to discuss without inhibition
to sit side-by-side and have a heart-to-heart talk (idiom)
to discuss/to converse/chat/discussion
to have a heart-to-heart chat
to arrange an interview/an appointment (with the foreign ambassador)
variant of 開誠布公|开诚布公[kai1 cheng2 bu4 gong1]
lit. deal sincerely and fairly (idiom); frank and open-minded/plain speaking/Let's talk frankly and openly between ourselves./to put one's cards on the table
lit. to live and sleep together (idiom); fig. a close friendship
to talk with sb (face to face)/discussion/talk/chat
to chat/casual conversation
